name: BANZAI PECAN: The Last Hope For the Young Century
description: REGAIN JUSTICE! Use the divine art BANZAI SHINKEN to restore justice in this old-school arcade-style hard-knuckle brawler!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista/7/8 Processor: 1.5 GHZ dual-core Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: AMD Radeon X series, NVidia GeForce GT, or better. DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 500 MB available space
recommended_requirements: DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 500 MB available space Sound Card: Universal Audio UAD-2 QUAD Core Additional Notes: A Logitech Gamepad is highly recommended

reviews.review_text: I played it for a half hour and my thumb already began to hurt from all the button mashing. Why is there no pause button? Don't press Esc or it will insta-quit to the main menu without an 'Are you sure?' prompt.

What a joke of a game. Menu doesn't work with arrow keys but with wasd, which isn't too hard to figure out, but to get to the tutorial you need to enter a menu point. Of course, enter doesn't work, neither does space, neither does the mouse. The only way to figure out it is 'j' is to hit all the buttons on your keyboard. In the short tutorial game when you start the game on easy the tutorial text disappears randomly so you can't read it while the lady beats you up and you're trying to figure out which keys to hit for what. There are too many good games to waste my time trying to find out how to play this one. The gameplay itself is standard for a fighting game. The graphic style doesn't resonate with me either.

If you're looking for a stroll in the park side scrolling beat'em up, then this IS NOT the game for you. Even on the easiest setting, GREEN MODE, does nothold your hand. Granted my personal reaction time plays a role in the decision, however, the demand for a quick reaction time is still rather quick. When other gamers have said that this game is hard, they're not lying. If you love challenging games then this is for you.
I hope you like mashing the J button.

The 'struggle' funciton when you land a blow at the same time as the other opponent is as unresponsive as my homeless father who has been the best 'Hide and Seek' player in the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ galaxy. What did I do, dad? Did I not wear skirts that were to your liking? It's getting hard to type on this keyboard through my tears.  Disappointed Dad/10
